website_summaries.verdict: Despite the numerous and quite noticeable improvements of the 840 v4 from its predecessor, many users were happy that the shoe has retained the dynamic and solid performance it provides. Many consumers have expressed their satisfaction with the purchase and thought that the 840 v4 was a worthy investment.
pros: The shoe provided excellent support, even when not used for running, according to a satisfied buyer
The midsole felt more cushioned than its predecessor, a runner claimed
Another person noticed its flexibility and adequate arch support
One user said the insole included with the 840 v4 provided a durable underfoot cushioning
Many wearers felt an improvement in the shoe’s balance and medial
The New Balance 840 v4 offered a long-lasting comfort even during an all-day wear, as mentioned by a customer
cons: The 840 v4 was too tight, and the foot did not fit in very well, a user complained
The material of the shoe felt hotter and looked cheaper compared to the previous version, a disappointed customer said
The shoe did not work well with custom orthotics, a dismayed buyer lamented

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: After visiting the New Balance store in Philadelphia, and getting advice on which shoe I should be wearing, I have settled on the 840 series. The last 3 of which were the 840v3, so when I saw the 840v4 I knew I had to try it. Love the updated look, and the fit is still right on. Wore them the day after receiving and had no issues at all, comfortable shoes for my daily outings. I know these are running shoes, but they are my everyday shoes for me, light weight and comfortable for the long day.
customer_reviews.author: RStauffer

customer_reviews.title: Great for heavier people!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband who is heavy like me. He took out the inner sole and put in a gel one and now He’s walking on a cloud! Best sneakers we’ve found for heavier people. Wish they were a little cheaper so we could buy more than one pair at a time but definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: More Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: I have been walking in NB shoes for a long time. My previous shoes, the 840 V3 were discontinued, so I picked up these. There's an obvious different fit, too large in the forefoot compared to the exact same size in the prior shoe. NB has also made some cheapening moves, such as deletion of the lace keeper between the bottom two eyelets, deletion of the exterior reinforcements on the lace eyelets, and who knows what I can't see. Overall, material seems to have more plastic, less fabric. I'd take a look at these in hand before plunking down the money. I plan on shopping around for other brands, NB just isn't the brand it was
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great runner
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th generation of New Balance shoes. I'm 220lbs and run distance (10+ miles) and these shoes are my go to brand. They are roomy in the toe box which I love because I have bunions. I order a 1/2 size up from my business shoes so my feet can float. These are an excellent shoe if you use orthotic inserts because they are neutral.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stapleton

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort
customer_reviews.text: Good, well fitting shoes are a necessity for me. When I try to get more mileage out of a pair that has worn out, I regret it. These make all the difference. However, I will say it's important to get the right fit and to do so I went to the New Balance store for the first pair and, for me, that also required an insert. Once I knew these were the real deal, I ordered this pair in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: prairiegal

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I wear orthotics, and I purchased this shoe based on a recommendation from my podiatrist. Overall, I like the show a lot. It fits my orthotic and has one of the largest toe boxes I've ever seen in any shoe. It's also reasonably stylish and not terribly expensive. The only negative is that I've found the soles to wear down in the front much more quickly than I'd expect. My last pair only lasted 4 month. I do walk a lot with my dog, but I'm not walking enough to see that kind of wear. It might be the cost of having a comfortable shoe that works with my orthotic. As usual, YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Smith

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I got these shoes in the WIDE version because of a foot problem I'm having (Tailor's bunion on left foot). I couldn't be more pleased. As soon as I wore the shoes for the first time the foot pain was gone. AND, the cushioning is excellent....about as good as the Hokas I'd been wearing. And that says a lot. I expected the shoes to be good, but they are much better than my highest expectations. I walk four miles a day, and the shoes are wonderful for that. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: T. Caperton

customer_reviews.title: Wears out in 4 months as opposed to a year in previous version of same shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing NB 840 since V1 and have been happy in the past. The v4 however is TERRIBLE. The soles of both of my shoes have worn down past the tread in just over 4 months. As a point of comparison, my v3 pair (which had been relegated to yard work) are now back to being my daily shoe, as they are in better shape after a year. While I did love the 840, time to find a new show that takes my inserts and lasts at least 6 months of daily wear.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Blair

customer_reviews.title: Great sneaker... but used, NOT new.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these ones for my son. Unfortunately, we didn't take them out of the box until after the 30 day window for return. They were clearly used. No tags, laces untied, sole was not clean. Someone had tried them on, walked around the house or lightly outside, and returned them. After paying $120 for a pair of sneakers, you expect to receive new, unworn shoes. Now, we are stuck with these shoes, and feel cheated. I am very disappointed Amazon is allowing this to happen.
customer_reviews.author: amargar

customer_reviews.title: I am a New Balance (this shoe) convert!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a former long time Asics user (near end of my running years and after My back said no running. I have a fairly narrow heel and wider toe area. Asics recently has narrowed their toe-box. After several pair thinking that would change, I recoginzed thhe definition of insanity. Hence, just before a two week trip to UK and Ireland, where we would do a lot of walking, we went to the New Balance store and got fitted. this shoe fits so nicely, I got another pair - this one. It feels lovely, looks fine, the shipping was very punctual. So I am verry happy.
customer_reviews.author: Gary H

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding comfort
customer_reviews.text: I am not a runner, but an avid walker. I also wear orthotics, have a wide foot and a Hammer Toe. This sneaker is very well made, it offers a roomy box toe and very good support. The mesh upper allows excellent ventilation. The bottom is solid and each step I take my feet are being lovingly taken care of. The most comfy sneaker I have ever worn!
customer_reviews.author: PungoBrad

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for my Plantar Faciitis Issues...
customer_reviews.text: I have Plantar Faciitis and recently experienced a significant flare-up which required me to see a Podiatrist. She provided a list of recommended walking/running shoes and this model was on the list. The doctor also provided an orthotic for me to use. I did try that in my previous walking shoes (different brand) and still had issues. Once I moved the orthotic to the NB, I was able to finish my workouts without heel pain.
customer_reviews.author: DCAS

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have had a number of issues with my feet over the last year or so. I've even had a toe amputated due to an infection in the bone. As a result I've developed a very large protruding bunion due to shifting of two toes. This has necessitated a wide, flexible shoe. My podiatrist recommended New Balance. I went to the NB store in Dallas and the young man recommended these shoes. I bought a pair. This pair is just an additional one. They are perfect for my bunion and very soft and comfortable. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SoTXBear

customer_reviews.title: Works for wide feet.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only shoe we have found that fits my husband’s crazy wide feet. He has very wide toes with an extremely high arch. We bought it in 4E, and added a nice arch support orthotic, and it is perfect for his feet. He has struggled with Plantar Faciatas issues in the past, but this combo seems to work for him. He uses them for running, and really all the time.
customer_reviews.author: crazywithkids

customer_reviews.title: Light and airy
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and well vented shoe, but for me there was a problem. I have a very thick big toenail and it has penetrated the very thin lining of the shoe and would have penetrated the outer shell as well...but I glued a piece of leather inside the lining just over the subject toenail and this seems to have mitigated my problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roomy & comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical ordering these. I usually purchase the Brooks beast. However Brooks went up to $229.00. These new balance fit well, I'm a 14 EEE. I purchased the extra wide, plenty of room for me. The support of the arch feels good. The laces are extra long, even when using the extra eye hole on the sneakers. Overall I think I've found a new walking sneaker.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable and fit well
customer_reviews.text: I have a wide foot and need a roomy toe bed. I have tried multiple NB models and this is by far the best fit for me. Plenty of room and look nice too. Unfortunately, I will no longer be buying from New Balance. I was saddened to learn they are supporters the president so they I will find a new brand that fits me well.
customer_reviews.author: toniv

customer_reviews.title: New Balance Restored
customer_reviews.text: Wow ... what can I say about this shoe. Fits like a glove. I have 4E feet with big'ol' bunions and these shoes are great. Can't even tell that my bunions are there. They fit snug but not tight.... don't slip in the heel ...and are comfortable to do my walking in. Light as a feather. They also provide me with plenty of arch support.It's been years since I have had a shoe fit this well.
customer_reviews.author: Louis S. Meeks

customer_reviews.title: Put a hitch in my giddy up.
customer_reviews.text: I run every day for about 50 minutes out on the streets and parks. These shoes caused me long term problems with ankle pain. After about a month I noticed a major pain developed. I went back and forth with them to confirm. Something about the camber of the sole I think is the problem. Not recommended for runners.
customer_reviews.author: J. Trolinger

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I generally don't write reviews but after using these shoes for a couple of weeks I figured I had to. These are the most comfortable running shoe I've ever owned. Although my days of actually running in running shoes are long over, these are also fantastic for brisk walking. Don't think twice about buying them. You will not regret it. Just do it! (Ooops, wrong company for that slogan)

Anyone that wears the NB 840 running sneakers knows that they usually come in only 2 or 3 basic colors. Not NB's most stylish shoe so I am ecstatic with my *special edition* 840v4.

customer_reviews.title: These are really nice.

Now, a week later, the soreness is gone. Still a little in my feet, due to arthritis, but nothing like it was before I started wearing these shoes. I wear 4E, and the EW fit perfectly, with a lot of width in the toe area.
customer_reviews.author: marshallbeach

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased

The cushioning is very soft, which is great if you tend to have a knee, ankle, or hip that tends to ache (in other words, if you are over 30). The weight of the shoes and materials are agreeable, as is the look of the shoes as you look down at them - which actually matters a lot in terms of how you feel about the shoes as you run in them. Nice job, New Balance.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: High hopes for this shoe, just arrived minutes ago...
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was one day earlier than expected and very happy with the fit so far. If these shoes can keep me pain free for a few months or more I will upgrade to 5 star but as of just walking around the house today they seem strong and support the arch very well.

I am beyond happy with them.
